options.html: Make our own shafts and/or gears

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked:
Shim tape.

Wear gloves, no joke, those cuts suck.

posts.name: Rich Jr
posts.cooked:
We stopped using shim tape for this reason, wasn’t worth the risk for us.

We do a combo of making our own shafts and Loctite/glues.

user_custom_fields.user_field_4: FRC 271 | Lead Mentor | Fabworks Discount Code: FRC271

posts.cooked:
Poll is missing the two best options for eliminating backlash.

Clamping mounts just grab onto the shaft and have 0 backlash. You can custom make them with a slitting saw, or buy them from gobilda if you are ok using metric and aren’t under too much load.

Eliminating hex shaft. No hex shaft, no backlash, no problem. While not always an option, it fairly often is one and should be one of the first things considered.

posts.name: Ryan Swanson
posts.cooked: My preferred “Other” method is to design hex shaft out of the equation by using spline.

posts.name: Skye Leake
posts.cooked:
This is a good point, although the amount of COTS that supports clamping is significantly less (both in part numbers and stocked in people’s shops)

Not that it is overly difficult to obtain… Just may not be in the shaft collar box by default.

Imo shim tape is the best retrofit option, as it works basically everywhere. Even with the cut risk.

posts.name: John Hascall (he)
posts.cooked:
Alex_Y:

Clamping mounts just grab onto the shaft and have 0 backlash. You can custom make them with a slitting saw, or buy them from gobilda id you are ok using metric and aren’t under too much load.

Thanks, I had never seen these!

posts.name: AgentSmith451
posts.cooked: The 1/2" hex shaft we’ve ordered from McMaster-Carr or Onlinemetals is a bit oversize so you have to press fit it together. (Check the dimension spec before ordering)

posts.name: Halil Ömer Çelik
posts.cooked: If possible, we try to avoid hex to hex interfaces in systems that require position control. We also take care to use shim tape on the gears inside the gearboxes.

posts.name: Christoforus Cedric Kurniawan
posts.cooked: What would you use instead of hex?
Single machined parts, face mounts, clamp mounts in that order of reduced backlash

A spline interface. MAX Spline or probably my favorite non-motor product released in the last few years, SplineXL. These have very minimal backlash. And in the case of SplineXL you can use it as a live axle for gear or sprocket reduction if desired because of the variety of options WCP sells for that
